Package Main

Class HomeMenu

java.lang.Object
java.awt.Component
java.awt.Container
javax.swing.JComponent
Main.HomeMenu
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable
public class HomeMenu
extends javax.swing.JComponent
Public class HomeMenu is the first screen the player sees when starting the game. Public class HomeMenu contains 5 buttons which have different functionalities and also a PopUpMenu which shows some sample photos of some random levels.
Since:
28/11/2021
Version:
1.0
Author:
TanZhunXian, Filippo Ranza
See Also:
Serialized Form

  • Constructor Details

    • HomeMenu

      public HomeMenu​(GameFrame owner, java.awt.Dimension area) throws java.io.IOException
      This constructor is used to load all the buttons on the main menu and link them to their functions. Listeners are also matched to their relevant buttons to detect clicks to load the events.
      Parameters:
      owner - This GameFrame is used to link with the HomeMenu so that HomeMenu can access its methods.
      area - This is the size of the HomeMenu.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - This constructor throws IOException if menu background image is not found.

  • Method Details

    • paint

      public void paint​(java.awt.Graphics g)
      This method is responsible for painting and repainting the HomeMenu.
      Overrides:
      paint in class javax.swing.JComponent
      Parameters:
      g - This graphics class is used to paint the HomeMenu.

    • drawMenu

      public void drawMenu​(java.awt.Graphics2D g2d) throws java.io.IOException
      This method is responsible for painting and repainting the HomeMenu.
      Parameters:
      g2d - This graphics class is used to paint the HomeMenu.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - This IOException is thrown if the image for the PopUpMenu does not exist.

    • drawContainer

      private void drawContainer​(java.awt.Graphics2D g2d)
